result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack A. Svoke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. 

No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow through. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack A. Svoke

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:44 a.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM1243, 22CF606, 22CF1040.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu. 

Date and time set for JPTC. 
Parties are ready to proceed with plea hearing. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

21CM1243>>
State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT grants. 

22CF606>>
State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT grants. 

22CF1040>>
State moves to DRI: 
Count 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater); COURT grants. 
Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/Repeater); COURT grants. 

PLEA: 

21CM1243 Count 1 (Possess/Illegally Obtain Prescription/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.  

22CF606 Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Second and Subsequent Offense/Repeater)>> NO CONTEST. 

22CF1040 Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on 21CM1243: SWH for 1 year probation
COURT ORDERS on 22CF606 and 22CF1040:  SWH for 2 years probation; all concurrent with each other. 

CONDITIONS:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow through.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.   Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.  30 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge. 

COURT grants 31 days credit in 21CM1243/22CF606 and 29 days credit in 22CF1040 if revoked. 

Adj:  10:58 a.m.

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 22CF606 & 21CM1243: No contact with victim: J.E.C. or J.C. (co-defendant)  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
